page.title: 15FAMILY LIFE
page.content: Today is Thursday! As usual my husband Stuart is up with the lark at 6.30 and all set to go. My feet usually hit the floor at about 7.20! A quick breakfast and off with our retriever Shelley for her morning mousing trip in the old quarry. On arriving downstairs to the smell of my daughter Rachel's bacon butties and my son Mark's burnt toast, I hold a useless conversation with them as they are usually battling it out with words or glued to breakfast television. Rachel usually brings her favourite rabbit in for a quick hop round the room while I eat my one slice of Bovril on toast. (My diet is ruling my life!) She then feeds the two gerbils, ten goldfish, stick insects, dog and the other rabbit. We go our separate ways at 8.35.
